content:
Report to whom? With an expectation of what happening exactly?

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/blocking-sender
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
What Matt said. What do you mean "report"? Report to whom?

Unwanted mail cannot be dealt with the same way as unwanted phone calls (if that's what you mean). Some mail service providers like Gmail may let you report spam to help them identify spam at the server for that particular service, but that has no effect on the same message being received through some other mail service provider –– and again it's not even clear whether that's what you mean by "report".

What generic mail clients like Thunderbird do is provide their own local junk filtering capabilities on top of the filtering done at the server, which you may then train by marking as junk messages they didn't initially recognise as such.

And you may also set up filters to tell Thunderbird to do bad things to incoming messages that meet some criteria if you wish, so you never get to see them, but be careful with that or you may end up inadvertently missing messages you want to keep if you do it wrong.

You may learn about those Thunderbird features and capabilities here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: DavidGG

content:
lo state segnalando in molti, possibile quindi che si tratti di un bug. in tal caso va segnalato su Bugilla https://bugzilla.mozilla.org

inoltre sarebbe utile sapere:

  1. quale versione di Thunderbird
  2. con qual fornitore PEC
  3. eventuali estensioni installate

se disporro' di altre informazioni le condividerò a questo indirizzo: https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79407.0
creator: @next

content:
Gli utenti di questa sezione del forum parliamo tutti in italiano. Però devi fornire informazioni più precise se vuoi avere delle risposte pertinenti. Anzitutto descrivi esattamente cosa è accaduto e poi aggiuni il maggior numero possibile delle seguenti informazioni:

  1. Hai un backup recente?
  2. Versione di Thunderbird
  3. Versione del sistema operativo
  4. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  5. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  6. Estensioni installate
  7. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  8. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content:
E cosa ti impedisce di installare un programma migliore? O di consultare la posta via web?

Comunque se vuoi esporre i tuoi problemi con Thunderbird apri una discussione apposita. Per le polemiche sbagli posto.
creator: @next

content:
I can't definitively help you - that will have to wait for someone with more understanding.

However, I note that three orange.fr customers have had log in problems this morning. And a few more in the last few days.

There were two suggested solutions here - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1444408 - which were posted just under a year ago.

There have also been a few Email providers who have changed the method of authentication (and not told anyone - perhaps they've migrated people systematically?) - so I'd check this with orange.fr.

Please reply to this post so that your question goes back into the list of ones that need attention.

.oOo.

Je ne peux pas vraiment vous aider, il faudra attendre que quelqu'un de plus compréhensif vous le dise.

Je constate cependant que trois clients d'Orange.fr ont rencontré des problèmes de connexion ce matin. Et quelques autres ces derniers jours.

Deux solutions ont été suggérées ici - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1444408 - qui ont été publiées il y a un peu moins d'un an.

Il y a également eu quelques fournisseurs de messagerie qui ont changé la méthode d'authentification (et n'ont prévenu personne - peut-être ont-ils fait migrer les gens systématiquement ?) - je vérifierais donc cela avec Orange.fr.

Veuillez répondre à ce message afin que votre question soit réintégrée dans la liste de celles qui nécessitent une attention particulière.
creator: frisée
